items.content_html:
ðŸ‘‹ Hi, Chrome DevRel here!

Chrome 118 will soon ship with support for @scope.

  • Spec: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade-6/#scoped-styles
  • ChromeStatus: https://chromestatus.com/feature/5100672734199808

This PR adds this new at-rule.
items.title: Add css.at-rules.scope

items.content_html:
FF119 supports options.sendOrder as an option to the WebTransport.createBidirectionalStream() in
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1816925

Note that FF implements the returned stream as a WritableStream rather than WebTransportReceiveStream (as per spec) so there is no way to get the sendOrder out again. I'd document WebTransportReceiveStream except that no one has implemented it yet.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#29300
items.title: FF119 createBidirectionalStream sendOrder option

items.content_html:
FF119 supports Object.groupBy and Map.groupBy in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1792650

This removes the preference and updates to not being experimental.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#29303
items.title: FF119 Object.groupBy and Map.groupBy

items.content_html:
Fixes #20837 which was added as supported in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1832154

Note that there is no bcd collector test and this fails the wpt test for me https://wpt.live/picture-in-picture/disable-picture-in-picture.html

But I assume I'm doing something wrong.
items.title: FF116 HTMLVideoElement.disablePictureInPicture supported

Also added a few more words to the description - "Support for"
items.title: Update url syntax in offset-path

items.content_html:
Summary

Resolves #20795

Some but not all notes entries mention bug tickets that especially resolve a missing functionality for feature completeness against the standard, that for I've included this one within the new impl_url entry, but not the previous, "original" bug ticket (with which the ticket has been partially implemented) for two reasons:

  • easier implementation: I would have needed to research the original ticket with the partial implementation
  • relevance: From my understanding the impl_url entries relevance is mainly about "feature completeness", so it would be more relevant to have an insight into the remaining work, than an already resolved ticket.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: docs: `notes` to `impl_url` property migration leftovers

Related issues

Fixes #16135.
items.title: Update background-clip.json

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR provides data points for new technologies that allow performance enhancements via prerendering/prefetching, an area that we are documenting under the umbrella term "speculative loading".

Specifically, the new data points are for:

  • <script type="speculationrules">. Relevant ChromeStatuses:
    • https://chromestatus.com/feature/4694585584910336
    • https://chromestatus.com/feature/4899735257743360
    • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5355965538893824
    • https://chromestatus.com/feature/5740655424831488
  • PerformanceResourceTiming.deliveryType = "navigational-prefetch" An engineer informed me that this was implemented at the same time as the rest of the feature
  • Content-Security-Policy script-src="inline-speculation-rules". Relevant ChromeStatus: https://chromestatus.com/feature/5182859125456896
  • document.prerendering - was actually already added, but I checked it for correctness
  • document.prerenderingchange_event - was actually already added, but I checked it for correctness
  • PerformanceNavigationTiming.activationStart - was actually already added, but I checked it for correctness
  • Supports-Loading-Mode response header. Relevant ChromeStatus: https://chromestatus.com/feature/4899735257743360
  • Sec-Purpose support for <script type="speculationrules">. This was a difficult data point to fill in, as there are two different prefetch technologies that use this header, which have different support, but the actual Sec-Purpose feature is the same. I ended up reporting them both in a single data point with notes to explain the difference and using Chrome 110 for the support value, which is the latest version that all parts of <script type="speculationrules"> are supported in. But I'm not sure if that is the right way to do it really. Suggestions appreciated.

See also the Speculative navigations MDN documentation notes for more details about this area and the work being done.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add BCD for new speculative loading features

items.content_html: This PR adds the Bun runtime to BCD as requrested in #18484. Fixes #18484.
items.title: Add Bun server runtime to BCD

items.content_html:
Summary

Update Opera's compatibility data for Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy (CORP)

Test results and supporting details

  1. Tested by running WPT tests on Opera and checked devtools console for CORP related error messages (e.g. Failed to load resource: net::ERR_BLOCKED_BY_RESPONSE.NotSameOrigin)
  2. Opera 60 is based on Chromium 73, which was the version CORP was added to Chromium.
items.title: Include Opera 60+ support for `Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy`

items.content_html: This PR moves the WebAssembly API data out of the JavaScript builtins folder and into the WebAssembly folder. This is an attempt to fix #20349.
items.title: Move WebAssembly API out of JavaScript builtins

items.content_html:
Summary

Expands cookies.SameSiteStatus details to include the values this type takes with details of support and variations.

Related issues

BCD update for mdn/content#28721
items.title: cookies.SameSiteStatus update

items.content_html:
Summary

Add an api/ entry for Secure Payment Confirmation. It consists of three main sub-features:

  1. PaymentCredentialInstrument, a dictionary (minor)
  2. payment-extension, a WebAuthn extension that the SPC spec defines
  3. secure-payment-confirmation, a Payment Request payment method that the SPC spec defines

Test results and supporting details

Data was written using the author's knowledge of when SPC released on Chrome, and which other browsers inherit from Chrome. Some of this still needs to be manually verified, such as the status on Opera and Samsung Internet Browser.
items.title: Add BCD data for Secure Payment Confirmation

items.content_html:
This PR removes the type member of the area HTML element from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.2.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/html/elements/area/type
items.title: Remove html.elements.area.type from BCD
